resources.string: Do you really want to exit?

According to Law No. 10,436, which provides for the Brazilian Sign Language, in its 1st Article, Sole Paragraph, it is stated that: "It is understood as the Brazilian Language of Signals - Libras the form of communication and expression, in which the linguistic system of Visual-motor nature, with its own grammatical structure, constitute a linguistic system of transmission of ideas and facts, originating from communities of deaf people in Brazil. " (BRAZIL, 2002).
The Libras is given by the following manual alphabet:

The project InLibras was based on an idea already proposed by Guimar√£es (2013), whose main objective is to provide a tool in which parents and deaf children can learn Libras and, from this, develop a family interaction, which Is still greatly hampered by several factors. With this idea in mind, InLibras was developed for mobility and accessibility, allowing access to any place, time and device with only the requirement of internet access.
Deiziane Buganti deizibuganti@hotmail.com Developer of the InLibras Project
